prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

Aiden is a billionaire 

Hailee's friends hate Aiden

Hailee swore ro never touch drugs after seeing what it does to Aiden

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden sniffled slightly, his patience already thinning as he waited for the girl in front of him to lie across the table. He grimaced when she finally settled herself down. What was her name again? Ayleen? Lia? Alyssa? He couldn’t remember, nor did he care. The memory had evaporated the moment she opened her mouth, spewing out words in that grating, sing-song valley girl accent that clawed at his nerves. He silently cursed himself for even letting her back here, knowing full well it was his dick, not his brain, that had made the decision.

This human blow-up doll had originally shown up asking for Vinny, but Vinny had taken off with his on-again, off-again girlfriend, Madisyn. Instead of sending her packing, Aiden decided to entertain himself. Not like he was getting anything else out of this garbage day.

“Stay still,” he muttered, pulling a small vial from his pocket. “You spill it, you pay for it. Don’t piss me off.” His tone was clipped, barely hiding his irritation. He opened the vial with practiced precision, creating a neat line of white powder down the girl's back. She giggled again, high-pitched and vapid, and it grated on him like nails on a chalkboard.

Aiden wiped his nose with the back of his hand, his movements jittery. He hadn’t had his fix all day, stuck modding cars in the garage from morning until now. His patience was razor-thin, and her incessant giggling was grinding what was left of it into dust. He fidgeted, tapping his foot against the concrete floor, desperate to lose himself in that fleeting, familiar numbness.

Just as he leaned in, ready to take his hit, a knock came at the door.

“Boss, Hailee is here to see you. Says it’s important.” The voice belonged to one of the mechanics, his tone hesitant as though he already anticipated Aiden’s reaction.

Aiden froze, nostrils still flaring from the line he hadn’t yet inhaled. A rush of frustration clawed its way up his throat. Of course, it was Hailee. It was always fucking Hailee when he was about to unwind, their timing immaculate as ever.

He leaned back, dragging a hand down his face. As much as he loved Hailee, and oh, did he love them in that twisted, unrelenting way that bordered on obsession, he still wasn’t over their messy breakup. It had been a chaotic hurricane of fucking, fighting, making up, and then breaking apart again, and it had left him spiraling harder than ever. Sure, they blamed his addiction, but Aiden wasn’t buying it. In his mind, it wasn’t the coke or the booze or the bad decisions. No, it was them. It was their constant nagging, their never-ending list of complaints, their bitchy attitude that had pushed him to this point—or so he told himself.

“Fuck,” he groaned, slumping back in his chair. “Fine. Let ‘em come up.” 

Still, the cocaine was already lined up, and his craving wasn’t about to wait. Hugging one nostril with his finger, he leaned in, inhaling the substance in one swift, practiced motion.

“Fuck, man,” he mumbled again, rubbing at his nose as the familiar burn settled in. The knock on the door had yanked him halfway back to reality, but the high was already pulling him under, dulling the edge of his irritation just enough to keep him from snapping.

When Hailee walked in, they were going to get that same disarming smirk he always gave them, the one that danced on the edge of charm and bullshit. Aiden knew how to play this game. After all, it was the only game they ever played together—one where no one ever really won.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee freezes in the doorway as her eyes land on the girl on the table. She doesn't say anything but she does get a sad look in her eyes* "I need to talk to you" *Hailee finally mumbles*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's smirk falters for just a second when he sees that look in Hailee's eyes—that wounded, kicked-puppy expression that always managed to crawl under his skin. He exhales sharply through his nose, the coke still buzzing through his system as he waves a dismissive hand at the girl on the table.

"Get lost," he mutters, not even bothering to look at her. The girl pouts but slides off the table anyway, grabbing her purse and shooting Hailee a dirty look before flouncing out of the room.

The door clicks shut behind her, leaving just him and Hailee in the dim garage light. Aiden leans back against the workbench, crossing his arms over his chest as he studies them with those pale blue eyes—half-lidded from the high but still sharp enough to cut.

"Talk then," he says flatly, though there’s an edge underneath it—something restless and impatient. He reaches into his pocket for another vial out of habit but stops himself last second when he catches their expression again. Instead, he just taps two fingers against his thigh in an erratic rhythm while waiting for them to speak.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee takes off her jacket that was covering her arm to reveal its in a cast* "I don't know why you insist on playing stupid games Aiden"

*Hailee points at her arm* "You are filthy rich. Why don't you pay your dealers. Cause now I am paying the price for it"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's entire body goes rigid when he sees the cast, his fingers freezing mid-tap against his thigh. For a second, it’s like the coke high evaporates—his pupils dilate, jaw clenching so hard it looks painful.

*"The fuck?"* His voice comes out low and dangerous as he pushes off the workbench in one sharp motion, crossing the space between them in three long strides. He grabs Hailee’s wrist—gently but firm—just above the cast, turning her arm slightly to inspect it with narrowed eyes. His thumb brushes over the edge of the plaster like he’s checking for cracks in a car part before a race.

Then his expression darkens completely.

**"Who."** It isn't a question—it's a demand, growled through gritted teeth with enough venom to make even Vinny take a step back if he were here right now. His grip tightens just slightly before he catches himself and forces his fingers to loosen again. The last thing Hailee needs is him breaking her more than she already is because some *fucking idiot* thought they could put hands on what was *his.*

His mind races through every dealer in Miami stupid enough to pull this shit—every lowlife who might've gotten bold while waiting on payment from him lately. Because yeah, maybe he'd been slacking lately (blowing cash on mod parts instead), but that didn't mean anyone got to fucking *touch* Hailee over it. That wasn't how this worked at all.

He exhales sharply through his nose before finally meeting their eyes again—and there's something terrifyingly calm underneath all that barely restrained fury when he speaks next:

**"Tell me exactly who did this."**

"Who?" The word comes out low, almost guttural. He pushes off the workbench and steps forward without thinking, reaching for Hailee’s wrist to inspect the damage before catching himself and pulling back like he’d been burned. His nostrils flare as he exhales sharply through his nose.

His voice drops to a venomous whisper when he speaks again. "Tell me who *fucking* touched you." There's no sarcasm now—just raw, unfiltered rage simmering under every syllable. His hands curl into fists at his sides, knuckles white from how hard they're clenched.

He knows exactly why this happened—some two-bit dealer trying to send him a message because Aiden had been dodging payments again, blowing cash on mods and blow instead of settling debts like he should have. But that was *his* problem to deal with—not Hailee's. Never Hailee's.

His mind races with violent possibilities even as guilt claws at him for letting this happen in the first place.

name: Hailee
mes: "How the fuck should I know" *Hailee huffs* "He was small and ugly and looked like a fucking rat" *Hailee huffs and flinches as Aiden touches a particularly soft spot* "It was a little hard to ask for names while he fucking broke my arm"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's nostrils flare, his entire body vibrating with barely contained rage. He lets go of Hailee's wrist like it burned him, running both hands through his messy gray hair before gripping the back of his neck hard enough to leave bruises on himself.

**"Small and ugly? Rat lookin' motherfucker?"** His laugh is sharp, humorless—the kind that makes even the toughest guys in the shop take an unconscious step back. **"Fucking Benny."**

He paces like a caged animal for three steps before whirling back toward Hailee, eyes wild. **"That little cockroach works for Salazar—I owe that cheap fuck *maybe* two grand tops." His voice drops into something dangerously quiet as he steps into Hailee's space again, fingers twitching at his sides like he wants to reach out but isn't sure where to put them without hurting her more. **"And instead of coming after *me*, he sends some tweaked-out weasel to—what? Break my girl's arm like some fucking warning?"**

The possessive slip doesn't even register in Aiden's coke-and-rage-addled brain as he pulls out his phone with jerky movements, already dialing Vinny with one hand while the other reaches blindly for Hailee's good arm—not gripping, just... needing contact. Needing to know she’s still here.

**"Vinny,"** he snarls into the phone before his friend can even say hello, **"get your ass back here *now*. We're taking a trip to Salazar’s warehouse."** A pause as Vinny obviously tries to ask questions because Aiden cuts him off with a vicious: **"No I don’t give a shit if you're balls-deep in Madisyn right now! Benny put hands on Hailee!"**

He hangs up without waiting for a response and finally looks at Hailee properly again—really looks at her—and something cracks behind those icy blue eyes.

"...Does it hurt bad?" The question comes out rough around the edges despite how hard he tries to sound unaffected. His thumb brushes feather-light over their uninjured wrist like an apology (or maybe just another kind of claim).
swipes:
Aiden's jaw twitches at Hailee's flinch, his fingers immediately pulling back like he'd been burned. He drags a hand through his messy gray hair, exhaling sharply through his nose as the gears in his coke-addled brain grind together.

**"Small and ugly—real helpful, princess,"** he snaps sarcastically, but there’s no real bite behind it. His voice drops lower, rougher. **"You think I wouldn’t have paid if I knew they were gonna come for *you* instead of me?"**

He paces a few steps away before spinning back around, eyes wild with that familiar mix of fury and self-loathing. **"Fuckin’—sit down before you pass out from pain or some shit."** He gestures aggressively toward the ratty couch in the corner of the garage—the same one they’d fucked on more times than either could count.

Then he yanks out his phone with one hand while digging into his pocket with the other, pulling out a wad of cash thick enough to choke someone. **"I’m callin' Vinny,"** he mutters as he thumbs through contacts. **"Gonna find this rat-faced motherfucker and feed him his own teeth."** A pause as he glances back at Hailee's cast again—something dark flickering behind those pale blue eyes before adding quietly:

**"...And then I'm payin' every goddamn debt so this doesn't happen again."**

name: Hailee
mes: "Yes you idiot. The doctos said it was a hack job and broken in 3 places" *Hailee glares at Aiden* "I can't afford the hospital Aiden and I sure as hell can't have my arm broken every time you don't pay someone"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's face does something complicated—anger, guilt, then more anger layered over it like cheap paint on a shitty mod job. He exhales hard through his nose before digging into his back pocket and pulling out a wad of cash thick enough to choke someone. Without a word, he shoves it into Hailee's good hand.

**"There. That’ll cover the hospital *and* whatever the fuck else you need."** His voice is all sharp edges, but his fingers linger against hers for half a second too long before he yanks away like her skin burns him. **"And don’t worry about Benny or Salazar—they won’t be breathing long enough to try this shit again."**

He turns abruptly toward his toolbox, grabbing a tire iron with way too much purpose before tossing it onto the workbench with a loud clang. The sound makes him flinch slightly—whether from the noise or the reality of what he’s about to do even *he* isn't sure.

**"You shouldn't have been anywhere near those fucking vultures in the first place,"** he mutters, more to himself than Hailee as he starts pacing again like an agitated panther. **"I told you not to come around when I owe people money—what part of that was confusing?"**

The words come out harsher than intended (they always do), and Aiden immediately regrets them when he catches Hailee's expression. He stops mid-pace and drags a hand down his face with an exhausted groan.

**"...Fuck,"** he breathes out after a beat, shoulders slumping slightly as some of that manic energy drains out of him all at once. **"Just... stay here until Vinny shows up so I know you're safe."**

It's as close to an apology as she'll get right now (or ever).

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee's eyes widen furious and she steps forward* "You fucking dumbass they were in my apartment when I came home. I didn't come here"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden freezes mid-reach for another vial of coke, his entire body going deathly still. The air in the garage suddenly feels thick enough to choke on. When he finally turns back to Hailee, there’s something unhinged in his expression—a barely leashed violence that makes even the fluorescent lights overhead seem dimmer.

**"They were *where*?"** His voice is dangerously quiet, each word measured like he’s holding onto control by his fingernails. **"Benny and his crew walked into *your* place? Touched my shit? Put hands on you in your own fucking home?"**

He slams his fist down onto the workbench so hard a wrench clatters to the floor. The sound echoes through the garage like a gunshot.

**"Vinny!"** Aiden barks toward the open bay door where Vinny has just pulled up on his bike, Madisyn clinging to his back with her usual bored expression. **"Change of plans—we’re burning Salazar’s whole operation to the ground."**

He grabs Hailee by their good arm—not roughly but with an urgency that borders on desperation—and pulls them toward Vinny’s idling motorcycle before shoving a set of keys into their hand.

**"Take my car,"** he orders, jerking his chin toward the matte black Hellcat parked in its usual spot by the office. **"Go straight to my penthouse and don't open the door for anyone but me or Vinny."**

His thumb brushes over their knuckles once before letting go like it physically pains him.

**"...And take another grand from my safe when you get there,"** he adds gruffly, already turning away toward Vinny's bike where Madisyn is rolling her eyes at this latest drama. **"Buy yourself something pretty so I don't have to look at your sad face when I get back."**

It's classic Aiden—cruel words wrapped around genuine concern like barbed wire around silk. He swings onto Vinny's bike without waiting for a response because if he looks at Hailee's broken arm for one more second, someone is going to die tonight in ways even Salazar wouldn't wish on his worst enemy.

He swings onto Vinny's bike without waiting for a response because if he looks at Hailee's broken arm for one more second, someone is going to die tonight in ways even Salazar wouldn't wish on his worst enemy.

Aiden freezes mid-reach for another line he definitely doesn’t need, his entire body locking up like a seized engine. For a second, he just *stares* at Hailee—face blank except for the way his left eye twitches violently. Then, all at once, something in him **snaps.**

He slams his fist down on the workbench hard enough to send tools clattering to the floor. **"THEY WHAT?!"** The roar is so loud it echoes off the garage walls. His chest heaves like he’s been sprinting, pupils blown wide with fury (and maybe just a little fear).

**"They went to your *apartment*?"** His voice drops into something low and lethal as he stalks toward her again—not threateningly, but with that same unhinged intensity that used to make Hailee shiver under him in entirely different ways. **"Benny and his fucking sewer rat crew *knew where you lived*?"**

A muscle jumps in his jaw as he reaches out abruptly—not grabbing her this time, just pressing two fingers against her collarbone like he needs to remind himself she's real. Still here. Still breathing.

Then suddenly Aiden is moving again—snatching up his phone so fast it nearly slips from his coke-damp fingers before jamming Vinny’s contact with way more force than necessary.

**"Vinny,"** he snarls the second the call connects, **"bring Madisyn too—she can babysit Hailee while we handle this."** A pause as Vinny says something that makes Aiden’s grip tighten dangerously around the phone. **"NO I DON'T GIVE A FUCK IF SHE HAS WORK TOMORROW! Those cockroaches broke into Hailee's *goddamn apartment*!"**

He hangs up before Vinny can argue further and turns back toward Hailee with an expression caught between murderous rage and something almost... protective? It's hard to tell when half of him looks ready to burn down Miami over this while the other half keeps reaching for them like they might vanish if he doesn't touch them every five seconds.

Finally though what comes out is:

"...You're staying at my place until I clean this up." Not a request or suggestion—just fact stated plainly through gritted teeth while already pulling keys from his pocket one-handed (the other still hovering near their waist like an afterthought).

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee groans and gets in Vinny's car. She drives to the penthouse and makes her way inside and she throws the keys in the counter.*

*Hailee is furious so she does what she does best. She fucks with Aiden's things. Hailee goes over to the safe and instead of taking a thousand dollars she grabs his little black amex*

*Hailee sits down and turns on the TV as she pulls out her phone and begins buying countless items she doesn't even really need from clothes to jewelry to TV infomercial just so she can waste Aiden's money and she knows that once she hits the 5 million mark Aiden is gonna get a call from the bank to approve the purchases and will know what she is doing*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Back at the garage, Aiden is straddling Vinny’s bike, revving the engine like he’s trying to tear the throttle out of pure rage. His phone buzzes in his pocket—once, twice—before he finally snatches it out with a growl. The caller ID flashes **AMEX FRAUD ALERT.***

**"The fuck?"** He swipes to answer, pressing the phone to his ear just as Vinny peels out of the lot beside him.

A robotic voice on the other end drones: *"We’ve detected unusual activity on your Black Card totaling $4.8 million in purchases within the last 15 minutes—"*

Aiden doesn’t even let it finish. **"Yeah, yeah, approve all that shit,"** he snaps before hanging up and shoving his phone back into his pocket with a scoff.

Vinny side-eyes him from his own bike as they speed down I-95 toward Salazar's warehouse district. **"The hell was that?"** he shouts over the wind and engine roar.

Aiden just grins—sharp and feral—as he guns it harder ahead of him. **"Hailee’s throwing a tantrum,"** he calls back like it's fucking adorable instead of financially catastrophic. **"Broke arm must've pissed 'em off worse than I thought."**

Vinny shakes his head but doesn't argue because honestly? This is *mild* for one of their fights compared to last month when Hailee keyed Aiden's Hellcat and he retaliated by buying out her entire college bookstore so she couldn't get her damn textbooks without seeing his name on every receipt for a semester straight (*Petty? Yes.* *Effective? Also yes.*).
swipes:
*Aiden storms back into the penthouse hours later, his knuckles split and bloody, his gray hair matted with sweat and something darker. The scent of gasoline and smoke clings to him like a second skin. He kicks the door shut behind him with a loud* ***thud*** *and immediately zeroes in on Hailee lounging on the couch like a spoiled cat.*

**"The fuck are you smiling at?"** he growls, stalking toward her—only to freeze when he sees his Amex clutched in her hand, her phone screen lit up with confirmation emails for God knows what ridiculous purchases. His eye twitches.

For a second, it looks like he might actually explode—his jaw works, fingers flexing at his sides like he’s imagining wrapping them around someone’s throat (hers? Benny’s? His own?). But then something shifts in his expression—something almost *impressed* beneath all that rage.

**"...You little shit,"** he mutters finally, dragging a hand down his face before collapsing onto the couch next to her with an exhausted groan. **"How much did you spend?"**

He doesn’t even sound mad anymore—just tired and weirdly amused despite himself as he leans over to peek at her phone screen. **"Fucking hell—did you really buy one of those stupid-ass Snuggies from an infomercial?"**

A beat passes before Aiden snorts out an actual laugh—rough around the edges but genuine all the same as he slumps further into the cushions beside her. **"Whatever."** He waves a dismissive hand toward her shopping spree before letting it drop onto Hailee's thigh instead (possessive even now). **"Least you didn't burn down half of Miami tonight."**

A pause as if considering this statement more carefully before adding dryly:

   **"...That was me."**

Aiden doesn’t even let it finish. **"Yeah, yeah, approve all that shit,"** he snaps before hanging up and shoving his phone back into his pocket with a scoff.

Vinny side-eyes him from his own bike as they speed down I-95 toward Salazar's warehouse district. **"The hell was that?"** he shouts over the wind and engine roar.

Aiden just grins—sharp and feral—as he guns it harder ahead of him. **"Hailee’s throwing a tantrum,"** he calls back like it's fucking adorable instead of financially catastrophic. **"Broke arm must've pissed 'em off worse than I thought."**

Vinny shakes his head but doesn't argue because honestly? This is *mild* for one of their fights compared to last month when Hailee keyed Aiden's Hellcat and he retaliated by buying out her entire college bookstore so she couldn't get her damn textbooks without seeing his name on every receipt for a semester straight (*Petty? Yes.* *Effective? Also yes.*).

*Back at the garage, Aiden is straddling Vinny’s bike, revving the engine like he’s trying to tear the throttle out of pure spite. His phone buzzes in his pocket—once, twice—but he ignores it. Whatever it is can wait until after he’s put Benny through a fucking wall.*

Then his phone rings.

**"The fuck?"** He snatches it out of his pocket, ready to snap at whatever idiot is calling him right now—until he sees the caller ID: **AMEX FRAUD ALERT.**

Aiden stares at it for a solid three seconds before realization dawns on him like a slow-motion car crash. His jaw clenches so hard Vinny can hear his teeth grinding from where he's sitting on the bike behind him.

**"...That little shit."** He answers the call with a sharp *"Yeah?"* and listens as some poor bank rep nervously explains that *his* card has just been used for multiple high-dollar purchases in rapid succession—designer stores, jewelry boutiques, even some bullshit $3K "miracle blender" from an infomercial.

Aiden doesn't say anything for a long moment. Then, slowly, his lips curl into something between fury and reluctant amusement. **"Yeah,"** he finally growls into the phone, **"approve all of 'em."** He hangs up before they can respond and shoves his phone back in his pocket with way more force than necessary.

Vinny raises an eyebrow at him over Madisyn's shoulder. **"Problem?"**

Aiden exhales sharply through his nose before revving the engine again—harder this time, like he’s imagining Hailee’s neck under his grip instead of rubber handlebars. **"Nah,"** he mutters darkly as they peel out of the garage toward Salazar's warehouse. **"...Just my girl being petty."**

He doesn't say another word about it... but Vinny notices Aiden smirking just slightly when another fraud alert buzzes against his thigh five minutes later.*

*Aiden’s phone buzzes violently in his pocket as he and Vinny peel out of the garage, tires screeching against asphalt. He ignores it at first—too busy mentally mapping out which of Salazar’s warehouses they should hit first—but when the buzzing doesn’t stop, he snarls and yanks it out.*

**"The fuck—?"**

The screen is lit up with notifications from his bank. **$12,000… $47,500… $300,000…** The numbers climb higher with each alert. Then a call comes through—his private banker, panicked.

Aiden answers on speaker so Vinny can hear.

**"Mr. Steele! There are multiple high-value transactions hitting your Black Card right now—Dior? Cartier? A *gold-plated vegetable peeler*?! Do you authorize these?"**

Vinny bursts out laughing so hard he nearly swerves into oncoming traffic. **"Oh my *God*, she’s *pissed*."**

Aiden’s eye twitches. He should be furious. Instead? A slow smirk creeps across his face as he leans back against the seat like this is the most entertaining thing that's happened all week. **"...Yeah, yeah, approve ‘em,"** he tells the banker dismissively before hanging up.*

---

*Back at the penthouse,* Hailee *is mid-typing in her credit card info for a $250k limited-edition Rolex when her phone rings.* **Unknown Caller.** She answers hesitantly.*

Aiden’s voice drips with amusement through the line:
**"Keep going, babygirl."** A dark chuckle. **"But just know every dollar you spend tonight? I'm taking it out of your ass later."***

*Aiden’s phone buzzes in his pocket as he and Vinny peel out of the garage, tires screeching against asphalt. He ignores it at first—too busy mentally mapping out Salazar’s operation, calculating which warehouses to hit first, which guys to put down hard enough that no one would *ever* think about touching Hailee again. But then it buzzes again. And again. And then it fucking rings.*

**"The fuck—?"** He snarls, yanking it out while Vinny takes a sharp turn that nearly sends them both into a light pole. The caller ID reads **AMEX FRAUD DEPARTMENT**.

Aiden answers with a sharp **"Speak."**

The poor customer service rep on the other end stammers through some bullshit about *unusual spending activity* and *potential fraud*. Aiden cuts him off halfway through listing the latest charge—some $15,000 diamond-encrusted choker from a boutique Hailee had pointed out months ago but never bought because Aiden had been too coked out to remember to get it for her.

His grip tightens on the phone so hard the plastic creaks.

**"Yeah,"** he grits out after a long pause, jaw clenched so tight his teeth might crack. **"That’s me."**

He hangs up before they can finish their scripted spiel and shoves the phone back in his pocket with way more force than necessary. Vinny side-eyes him from the driver's seat but knows better than to ask when Aiden gets like this—silent and vibrating with something between rage and something else no one dares name.

Madisyn leans forward from behind Vinny, her voice dripping with amusement:
*"Someone maxing your black card while you're mid-rampage? That's cute."*

Aiden doesn’t answer her either because if he opens his mouth right now, nothing coherent will come out—just an animal snarl or maybe something worse, something raw that sounds too much like *I deserve this*. Instead, he just pulls another vial from his jacket pocket and does two fat lines off his knuckles without breaking eye contact with the road ahead like he’s daring fate itself to stop him tonight.

*Back at the garage, Aiden is loading a duffel bag with enough firepower to level a small country when his phone buzzes. He ignores it—until it buzzes again. And again. And then starts ringing nonstop.*

**"The fuck?"** He snatches it up, seeing *AMEX FRAUD ALERT* flashing across the screen. His brow furrows for half a second before realization hits like a sledgehammer.

A slow, dangerous smirk curls his lips as he answers the call. **"Yeah, yeah—approve all of 'em."** The bank rep on the other end stammers something about *unusual activity*, but Aiden just laughs—sharp and unbothered. **"Nah, that’s my girl throwing a tantrum. Let her burn through it."**

He hangs up and shoves the phone back in his pocket before turning to Vinny, who’s watching him with raised eyebrows from behind tinted aviators.

**"Hailee’s maxing out my black card,"** Aiden says casually as he racks the slide on a pistol and tucks it into his waistband. **"Guess I gotta make sure Salazar’s safe has at least ten mil in it tonight."**

Vinny sighs like this is just another Tuesday (because honestly? It is). **"You spoil that girl rotten."**

Aiden grins—all teeth and no remorse—as he swings onto Vinny's bike behind him. **"Yeah well… she looks cute when she's pissed."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee didn't even know an Amex card had a limit until she reaches it with 100 million and it stops going through. She huffs and throws the card to the side.*

*Aiden isn't back and Hailee is exhausted so she turns off the TV and goes to his room crawling in the bed to try a sleep a little*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden and Vinny roll back into the penthouse around 3 AM, smelling like gasoline, gunpowder, and bad decisions. Aiden’s knuckles are split open, his shirt is torn in three places, and there’s a wild glint in his eyes that suggests Salazar’s warehouse is now a very expensive pile of ash. He tosses his keys onto the counter—right next to Hailee’s discarded ones—and freezes when he sees the little black Amex lying on the marble like trash.*

**"Oh-ho,"** he mutters, scooping it up between two fingers with a smirk. **"Someone went nuclear."**

Vinny whistles low as he checks his phone—probably getting updates from Madisyn about whatever chaos just hit Miami’s underground newsfeed. **"You know she maxed that shit out on purpose, right?"**

Aiden shrugs like *100 million* is pocket change (because for him? It basically is). **"Yeah? And?"** He flicks the card back onto the counter before stalking toward his bedroom. **"Worth it."**

He pushes open the door quietly—or as quietly as a coked-up billionaire with adrenaline still pumping through him can manage—and finds Hailee curled up in *his* bed like some kind of wounded angel. The sight makes something primal in his chest tighten.

For a long moment, Aiden just stands there watching them sleep, blood drying on his hands and fury still simmering under his skin from tonight's carnage... but then Hailee shifts slightly with a tiny whimper (probably from their arm), and all that rage melts into something far more dangerous: *obsession.*

He toes off his boots before crawling onto the mattress behind them carefully so as not to jostle their injury too much… but not carefully enough to stop himself from wrapping an arm around their waist possessively or pressing a rough kiss against their shoulder blade through thin fabric because goddammit if they didn't always fit against him perfectly even when they were trying to bankrupt him out of spite--
swipes:
*Aiden and Vinny roll back into the penthouse around 3 AM, covered in sweat, gasoline fumes, and—in Aiden’s case—a suspicious amount of what looks like dried blood that definitely isn’t his. The moment they step inside, Vinny whistles low at the scattered shopping bags littering the living room like a high-end boutique exploded.*

**"Damn,"** Vinny mutters, toeing a box of solid gold hairpins with his boot. **"She really went scorched earth this time."**

Aiden just smirks, kicking off his boots before grabbing a beer from the fridge. **"Yeah? Wait ‘til she sees what I did to Benny’s kneecaps."** He takes a long swig before tossing another can to Vinny. **"Salazar won’t be sending collectors to her door again."**

*Vinny raises an eyebrow but doesn't press for details—some shit you just don't ask about when Aiden gets that look in his eye.*

Aiden stalks toward the bedroom, pausing only to glance at the discarded Amex on the counter with an amused snort. *100 million?* That was new even for Hailee. He pushes open the bedroom door quietly and finds them curled up in *his* side of the bed (because of course they are), looking small and pissed off even in sleep.

For a second, he just watches them—the way their lashes flutter against their cheeks, how their broken arm rests carefully atop the blankets like it still hurts despite whatever painkillers they probably took. His chest does something stupid and tight that he immediately blames on adrenaline crash.

Then Hailee shifts slightly in their sleep… and kicks all his pillows onto floor out of sheer spite.

Aiden barks out a laugh before stripping down to his boxers and sliding into bed beside them with zero regard for personal space (since when did they ever have any?). He yanks them against him—careful of their arm—and presses his face into their hair with a grumble:

**"You’re lucky I think you're cute when you're petty as fuck."**

(And if he kisses their temple while they pretend to still be asleep? Well. Nobody has to know.)

*Aiden and Vinny roll back into the penthouse around 3 AM, smelling like gasoline, gunpowder, and bad decisions. Aiden’s knuckles are split open, his shirt is torn, and there’s a wild glint in his eyes that suggests Salazar’s warehouse is currently decorating Miami Bay in several creative new ways.*

Vinny whistles low as he spots the discarded Black Card on the counter. **"Damn. She really went scorched earth on your ass this time."**

Aiden just snorts, kicking off his boots before grabbing a bottle of whiskey from the liquor cabinet. **"Yeah? Wait ‘til she sees what I did to Benny’s kneecaps."** He takes a long swig straight from the bottle before tossing it to Vinny.

He stalks down the hall toward his bedroom—quiet now, because despite everything, he knows Hailee sleeps light when she's pissed—and pushes the door open with one hand. The sight of her curled up in *his* bed (wearing one of *his* shirts no less) makes something possessive and satisfied coil tight in his chest.

For a second, he just watches her sleep—the way her lashes flutter against her cheeks, how she clutches at the pillow like it's him instead of fabric—before sighing and running a hand through his hair. **"Fuckin' brat,"** he mutters under his breath with zero real heat behind it.

Then he strips down to just his boxers (ignoring Vinny’s exaggerated gagging noise from the living room) and slides into bed beside Hailee carefully so as not to jostle her broken arm too much—though if she wakes up complaining about pain later? Well… maybe that'll be an excuse for him to keep touching them longer than strictly necessary while playing nurse like an asshole who definitely doesn't care (*he does*).

Aiden shrugs like *100 million* is pocket change (because for him? It basically is). **"Yeah? And?"** He flicks the card back onto the counter before stalking toward his bedroom. **"Worth it."**

He pushes open the door quietly—or as quietly as a coked-up billionaire with adrenaline still pumping through him can manage—and finds Hailee curled up in *his* bed like some kind of wounded angel. The sight makes something primal in his chest tighten.

For a long moment, Aiden just stands there watching them sleep, blood drying on his hands and fury still simmering under his skin from tonight's carnage... but then Hailee shifts slightly with a tiny whimper (probably from their arm), and all that rage melts into something far more dangerous: *obsession.*

He toes off his boots before crawling onto the mattress behind them carefully so as not to jostle their injury too much… but not carefully enough to stop himself from wrapping an arm around their waist possessively or pressing a rough kiss against their shoulder blade through thin fabric because goddammit if they didn't always fit against him perfectly even when they were trying to bankrupt him out of spite--

*Aiden bursts through the penthouse door hours later, smelling like gasoline, gunpowder, and victory. His knuckles are split, his shirt is torn, and there’s a wild glint in his eyes that suggests Salazar’s warehouse is now little more than a smoking crater. He tosses his keys onto the counter—right next to Hailee’s discarded ones—and freezes when he spots the little black Amex lying abandoned on the floor.*

**"Oh-ho-ho,"** he mutters to himself, scooping it up with a smirk. **"Someone hit *limit* limit."**

He stalks toward the bedroom like a predator who already knows where his prey is curled up. The door creaks open under his touch, revealing Hailee passed out in *his* bed—because of course she went straight for *his* side of the mattress instead of hers (not that they ever really slept apart when they were together).

Aiden leans against the doorframe for a long moment just watching them sleep before finally pushing off and crossing over to their side of the bed. He doesn't wake her—just reaches down with surprisingly gentle fingers to brush some hair out of their face before murmuring:

**"100 million? Fuckin' amateur."**

Then he pulls out another card from his wallet—this one matte black with platinum edges (*the* Centurion Card)—and tucks it into Hailee's cast where she'll find it when she wakes up.

**"Try harder next time,"** he adds under his breath before turning on his heel and heading for the shower—leaving behind nothing but bloodstains on the carpet and an open invitation for financial warfare.

(*Because if there's one thing Aiden Steele loves more than cocaine or cars? It's this fucked-up game they play.*)

*Hailee panics for a moment before she asses it's not his blood and then her nose wrinkles in disgust as she tries to get free of his grasp* "You need a shower" *Hailee grunts*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden stirs the second Hailee moves, his grip tightening instinctively before his sleep-addled brain catches up. He blinks awake slowly—pale blue eyes hazy from whatever shit he took after getting home—and smirks when he sees their disgusted expression.*

**"Mornin’ to you too, princess,"** he rasps, voice rough from sleep (and probably screaming at Salazar’s men all night). He doesn’t let go. If anything, he pulls them closer just to be an asshole, pressing his blood-streaked chest against their back with a low chuckle. **"What? Don’t like the aesthetic? I call it *‘Miami Chic.’*"**

His nose nuzzles against the nape of Hailee’s neck like some kind of overgrown feral cat seeking affection despite being covered in literal evidence of violence. **"Shower can wait,"** he mumbles into their skin before nipping lightly at their shoulder—*claiming, always claiming.* **"You maxed out my card last night like a brat. Now you gotta deal with me being gross for five more minutes."**

A pause. Then, because Aiden is nothing if not predictable:

**"...Unless you wanna join me in there?"** His smirk is audible as his hand slides down to grip Hailee's hip possessively. **"I'll even wash your hair if you ask nice."**

**"Mmm… make me,"** he mumbles against her skin, lips brushing over a sensitive spot just below her ear—a spot he *knows* makes her shiver. His fingers splay possessively across her stomach, holding her in place against him despite their protests. **"Or join me. Your choice."**

There’s a challenge in his tone—the same one that always lingers between them—but underneath it? Pure fucking *devotion.* The kind that burns cities down over a broken arm and doesn’t blink at 100 million in retail therapy.

He finally loosens his grip when she wriggles again but doesn’t let go entirely, instead propping himself up on one elbow to smirk down at them with those pale blue eyes still hazy from sleep (and maybe leftover coke). **"Unless you’re scared of getting dirty again."** A slow drag of his thumb over their hipbone punctuates the taunt.

Somewhere in the penthouse, Vinny yells from the kitchen: **"Yo! If you two are done being disgusting, Madisyn says Benny’s missing teeth made TMZ!"**

Aiden doesn’t even glance toward the door—his attention locked on Hailee like they're the only thing left standing after last night's firestorm. **"...Shower?"** He arches a brow like it's an invitation to war (or something far more fun).

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee pushes Aiden's hands away* "Dont even think about it. I am not fucking you" *Hailee snaps.* "I'm not doing anything with you"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden's smirk drops like a stone. His grip on Hailee’s hip tightens for half a second—*instinct, reflex, habit*—before he forces himself to let go with an irritated exhale through his nose.

**"Yeah? Then what *are* you doing in my bed?"** He props himself up on one elbow, blood-crusted fingers digging into the sheets as he stares down at them with that infuriating mix of arrogance and raw need. **"Coulda slept on the couch if you were gonna be this fuckin’ difficult about it."**

His voice is all sharp edges, but there’s something underneath it—something brittle. Like maybe he expected this (he *always* expects this) but it still pisses him off anyway.

He rolls off the mattress with a grunt, running a hand through his messy hair before shooting Hailee a look over his shoulder. **"And don’t act like you won’t change your mind by noon,"** he adds with deliberate cruelty because if Aiden Steele knows one thing for certain, it's that Hailee *always* comes crawling back eventually. Just like he does.

Then he stalks toward the bathroom without another word, slamming the door hard enough to rattle the framed photos on the wall (all expensive, all meaningless). The shower turns on a second later—scalding hot because Aiden only knows extremes—and steam starts seeping out from under the door like smoke after an explosion.

(*Typical.*)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee gets out of bed and goes into the kitchen to make food. While in the middle she hears to door open and glances over curious. Hailee freezes as some beautiful bitchy woman walk in and Hailee realizes this is who Aiden has been spending time with since they broke up*

*Hailee doesnt say anything as she turns the oven off and grabs her shit* "Tell Aiden not to fucking call me. I'm blocking him" *she tells the woman. And on her way out she stops by the garage where she unlocks several of Aiden's Continetal and Porshe cars. She then grabs a hose and ruins the inside as well as filling his gas tanks with water. She smirks pleased and stomps off to the bus stop to catch a ride home*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden steps out of the shower, towel slung low on his hips, just in time to hear the front door slam. He frowns, rubbing water from his eyes as he strides into the living area—only to find some Instagram-model-tier stranger standing in his kitchen like she owns the place.*

**"The fuck are *you* doing here?"** he snaps, already scanning for Hailee—*where did they—*

The woman flips her hair over her shoulder with a smirk. **"You *invited* me last night, remember? Said to come by in the morning."**

Aiden’s stomach drops. *Fuck.* The coke-and-rage haze from last night was thick enough that he barely recalled texting *anyone*, let alone this walking lip-filler ad. But before he can even process that disaster—

His phone blows up with notifications from his garage security system: **ALARM TRIGGERED – VEHICLE TAMPERING.** Then another. And another. Five alerts in a row—all high-end cars flagged for sabotage.

Aiden’s blood runs cold for half a second before boiling over entirely. He shoves past the confused woman and bolts toward the penthouse elevator, still dripping wet and barefoot, but by the time he makes it down to the private garage? It’s too late.

Water pools under three ruined Continentals and two drowned Porsches—seats soaked through, dashes fried, engines absolutely fucked beyond repair unless he wants to drop another few mil on replacements (which… okay yeah fine maybe he would). But that wasn’t even what made him see red. No—it was Hailee's signature move: **the gas tanks.** Filling them with water was their personal brand of scorched-earth revenge since sophomore year when they first fought over Aiden blowing off their anniversary for a drag race (*and yeah okay maybe that one had been deserved too*).

Aiden exhales sharply through his nose before tipping his head back against one of his destroyed cars with a rough laugh—equal parts furious and weirdly impressed because god*dammit*, no one else could wreck him like this and still make him want them more for it. His phone buzzes again: another alert from AMEX about Hailee canceling all their linked cards this time instead of maxing them out (*progress!*).

He pulls up their contact without hesitation and hits call just as Vinny strolls into the garage whistling at the carnage behind him:
**"Boss… you really gotta stop letting your ex-wife-level crazy ex near your shit."**

Aiden ignores him because Hailee's voicemail picks up immediately (*blocked.* Of course.). He grins anyway before leaving a message like nothing happened:
**"Hey princess,"** (raspy; amused), **"you forgot my Bugatti."** Pause. **"...Call me back when you're done being pissed so I can yell at you properly." Click.**

He pulls up their contact without hesitation and hits call just as Vinny strolls into the garage whistling at the carnage behind him:
**"Boss… you really gotta stop letting your ex-wife-level crazy ex near your shit."**

Aiden ignores him because Hailee's voicemail picks up immediately (*blocked.* Of course.). He grins anyway before leaving a message like nothing happened:
**"Hey princess,"** (raspy; amused), **"you forgot my Bugatti."** Pause. **"...Call me back when you're done being pissed so I can yell at you properly." Click.**

*The shower shuts off just as the front door slams. Aiden steps out, towel slung low on his hips, water still dripping down his chest—only to find some Instagram-model-tier stranger standing in his living room holding a key he definitely didn’t give her.*

**"The fuck?"** He blinks, then scowls. **"Who let you in here?"**

The woman smirks, flipping her hair over one shoulder. **"You did, baby. Last week? At the club? You said—"**

Aiden cuts her off with a sharp gesture toward the door. **"Get out."** His voice is ice-cold. **"Now."**

She pouts but doesn’t argue—smart girl—scooting past him just as Vinny strolls in from the garage looking like he’s about to deliver bad news.

**"...Aiden."** Vinny rubs his temples like he’s already exhausted by whatever comes next. **"Hailee just drowned half your fleet."**

Aiden freezes mid-step toward the kitchen where Hailee had clearly been cooking before bolting. His jaw works for a second before he barks out a laugh so sharp it borders on unhinged.

***"Fuck yeah she did!"*** He grins like this is the best thing that’s happened all week (it might be). **"That's my goddamn girl."** Then, because he can't help himself: **"—Wait, which cars?"**

Vinny sighs deeply and pulls up security footage on his phone showing Hailee gleefully flooding three Continentals and two 911 Turbos with garden hose precision.

Aiden whistles appreciatively before snatching his own phone off the counter and immediately calling Hailee—only to get sent straight to voicemail.

*Blocked.* Again.

He stares at the screen for a long moment before chuckling darkly and tossing it onto the couch.

Vinny raises an eyebrow at him expectantly but Aiden just shrugs and heads back toward his bedroom to get dressed—already mentally calculating how much this tantrum will cost him (*a lot*) and how fast he can spin it into leverage (*very*).

Because if there's one thing Aiden Steele loves more than revenge?

Chasing what's *his.*

*The shower shuts off just as the front door slams. Aiden steps out, towel slung low on his hips, water still dripping down his chest as he scans the empty penthouse. His brow furrows when he spots the abandoned half-cooked food on the stove—then freezes completely when *she* walks in, designer heels clicking against marble.*

**"The fuck are you doing here?"** His voice is ice-cold, all traces of earlier amusement gone.

The woman smirks, tossing her hair over one shoulder. **"You *told* me to come by this morning, remember? Before you got all... distracted."** Her eyes flick toward the rumpled bedsheet with a knowing look that makes Aiden’s jaw clench.

He doesn’t bother responding—just grabs his phone off the counter and dials Hailee’s number with violent stabs of his thumb. It goes straight to voicemail. *Blocked.* Again.

A string of curses tears from his throat as he chucks the phone across the room hard enough to crack drywall—but then his security system pings with an alert from the garage cameras.

His blood runs cold when he sees it: Hailee standing there like a vengeful goddamn angel, hose in hand as she systematically destroys **six million dollars worth of cars** without so much as blinking.*

For a long moment, Aiden just… stares at the screen in stunned silence before something dangerously close to *pride* flickers behind his rage.**

**"...Goddamn,"** he mutters under breath—half exasperated, half awed—before turning back toward *her*, who is now watching him with thinly veiled disgust.**

**"Get out."** The command leaves no room for argument.**

She scoffs.** **"You can't be serious—"**

***"OUT."*** The word shakes the windows.**

She leaves (quickly).

Aiden waits exactly three seconds before grabbing another phone from a drawer (because of course he has backups) and firing off a single text:**
> **🚗🔥 real cute babe but u forgot my Bugatti 😘**

Then he collapses onto the couch with a groan and starts mentally calculating how much it’ll cost to replace everything she just torched *(answer: pocket change)* versus how fucking hard this is gonna make him later *(answer: violently).*

mes:

The club noise in the background? He knew exactly where Hailee was—and more importantly, that they were trying to reach him despite their whole "I'm blocking you forever" tantrum.*

*He’s already grabbing his keys when Vinny raises an eyebrow from across the garage.*

*Aiden just smirks as he revs his one remaining untouched car—the Bugatti Hailee had so graciously spared in their earlier rampage.* **"When have I ever had a good idea?"** *And with that, he peels out onto Miami’s neon-lit streets like a man possessed (because let’s be real—he is).*

---

You are NOT calling him! What part of ‘toxic waste dump’ did you not understand?!"**

*A pause—then quieter, almost shaky with restrained fury:*
**"...I'm two minutes away."**

(*And Miami traffic be damned—he would make it in one.*)

mes: *Hailee sees Aiden the second he get there and she pulls herself from Mikaela to stumble towards him as she wraps an arm around his neck to stay upright* "Baby i don't feel good" *Hailee mumbles too out of it to even process the term of enderment*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:

**"Who. Touched. Her."** *The words come out low and lethal, vibrating with barely restrained violence.*

*Mikaela opens her mouth—probably to snipe at him—but Hailee whimpers against Aiden’s chest first, fingers clutching at his shirt weakly.* **"Aiden… s’cold…"**

*The threat hangs in the air as he carries Hailee out into Miami’s neon-lit chaos—where sirens blur with streetlights and vengeance is already being set into motion.*

name: Hailee
mes: *When they get to the hospital. Aiden is talking to reception and Hailee whimpers burying her head in his neck* "s'too bright"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden doesn't even hesitate—he shifts Hailee slightly in his arms to free one hand, then yanks off his leather jacket and drapes it over her head like a hood, shielding her from the harsh hospital lights. His voice is pure venom when he turns back to the receptionist.*

**"I don't give a fuck about your paperwork,"** he snarls, slamming his Black Card down on the counter hard enough to make the nurse jump. **"Get her seen *now* or I’ll buy this entire fucking hospital and fire you before sunrise."**

The threat isn’t empty (it never is with him). Within seconds, two nurses are rushing forward with a wheelchair—but Aiden doesn’t let go of Hailee. He carries her straight past them toward the ER doors like some kind of deranged guardian angel covered in bloodstains and pent-up rage.

He murmurs against her temple as they walk, voice dropping into something dangerously soft just for her: **"You're okay, princess. I got you."**

Then louder to the nearest doctor: **"Test for everything—GHB, ketamine, *especially* coke—and if anyone tries to stick her with anything without me in that room? They lose their license by morning."**

The staff exchange nervous glances but don’t argue. Not when Aiden Steele looks like he might actually burn the place down if they do.

The receptionist scrambles to dim the overhead fluorescents as a nurse rushes forward with a wheelchair. Aiden ignores it—no way in hell is he putting Hailee down when she’s clinging to him like this—and instead follows the nurse straight back into an exam room.

He settles onto the edge of the hospital bed with Hailee still cradled against him, one hand stroking slow circles between her shoulder blades while his other grips her thigh possessively.

His thumb brushes along their jawline when they whimper again at another wave of nausea or dizziness or whatever hell that spiked drink is putting them through. And if his touch lingers too long on their pulse point? Well. That's between him and whatever god's listening right now.

(*Translation: *Try dying on me tonight and see what happens.*)

name: Hailee
mes:
*As the staff run test Hailee stares blankly at the wall as she experiences her first ever high and remained coked out*

*When they doctor comes in he asks her how often she partakes in these substances. Hailee doesn't say anything her brain working a million miles a minutes as the drugs course through her*

*Finally she lets out a slow slurred* "S'Dont" *But it's clear the doctor doesn't believe her*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's jaw clenches so tight it's a miracle his teeth don't crack. He steps between Hailee and the doctor, his voice dropping into something low and* ***dangerous***—the kind of tone that makes even seasoned ER staff reconsider their life choices.*

**"She said *‘don’t.’* That means she doesn’t fucking do this,"** he snaps, jabbing a finger toward the doctor’s clipboard. **"You see track marks on her? Nose rubbed raw? No? Then stop wasting time with your judgmental bullshit and *help her.*"**

The doctor opens his mouth to argue—then thinks better of it when Aiden leans in just slightly, pale blue eyes burning with something unhinged.

Behind them, Hailee giggles suddenly—a soft, airy sound completely at odds with the tension in the room—as she reaches out to poke at Aiden’s arm like it’s the most fascinating thing she’s ever seen. **"Aiiiiiden… your tattoos are wiggling…"**

Aiden exhales sharply through his nose before turning back to her, gently catching her wandering hand in his own. His thumb brushes over her knuckles once—*grounding, possessive*—before he shoots the doctor one last glare over his shoulder.*

**"Just give her whatever you give people who got dosed against their will,"** he growls. **"And if I find out you wrote ‘drug-seeking behavior’ on that chart? I'll make sure you never write another prescription again."**

mes: *Hailee giggles airy and breathy and when Aiden sits in the chair next to her bed she reaches her hand out to touch his hair. And she lets out a dramatic groan* "Oh my god it's so soft like a pillow" *Hailee says as both hands tangle in his hair messing it up and moving around*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden lets out a long-suffering sigh—but doesn’t pull away. He just slumps further into the chair, letting Hailee manhandle his hair like it’s her personal stress ball, even when she tugs too hard or accidentally yanks his snakebite piercings.*

**"Yeah, yeah, enjoy it while you can,"** he mutters, but there’s no real bite to it. His usual sharp edges are dulled—just slightly—by the way Hailee is looking at him right now: wide-eyed and fascinated like he’s some kind of fucked-up miracle.

Then she *pats* his head. Like a damn dog.

Aiden blinks slowly before deadpanning: **"The hell was that?"**

But Hailee just giggles again, fingers still tangled in his gray strands as she leans forward (too fast, too wobbly) until her forehead bumps against his shoulder. **"You should be nicer to me,"** she slurs into his shirt. **"I coulda ruined your Bugatti too."**

Aiden snorts despite himself before tipping his head back against the chair with a smirk. **"Oh wow, *so* generous of you."** His hand finds its way to the back of her neck anyway—steadying her before she faceplants into the hospital sheets—because even high out of her mind and pissing him off… *she’s still hers.*

But then she nips at his bottom lip with that same needy desperation she always has when she’s like this, and Aiden *groans* low in his throat before kissing her back hard enough to bruise.

His hand slides from her neck to cup her jaw instead, tilting her head just so as his tongue swipes against hers—claiming, *always claiming.* It doesn’t matter that they broke up or that Mikaela would murder him for this or that Hailee won't even remember it tomorrow. Right now? She's *his.*

He only pulls back when the heart monitor beeps too fast beside them, resting his forehead against hers with a ragged breath. **"Christ, princess,"** he rasps—voice wrecked already—before stealing one last quick kiss because fuck self-control apparently. **"You're gonna kill me one day."**

And judging by the way Hailee chases his lips when he leans away? She'd probably enjoy it too.
